author: Arnoud Edens
comment: Nice and clean. Only thing missing (for me at least) is an option to invert the standby screen. On the Sony's transflective LCD that would lead to better legibility when the backlight is off

reply.author: Logan Graham
reply.content: Thanks for the feedback. I'll see about adding an option to customize the standby display.

author: Jay Leber
comment: Needs option to hide leading zero.  Seconds go off screen.  What is Sneak Peek?  Add, Fix, Explain, then 5 stars.
title: Nice, but one

author: Daniele Lapi
comment: Would give it five stars apart from the day and date doesn't change sometimes. If I reset my watch that seems to fix it. Sony smartwatch 3
title: Great watch face

author: Maximilian Lattka
comment: For me, all the fonts look exactly the same Edit: suddenly worked out
title: Fonts look the same

author: Stu Gott
comment: Can no longer control brightness after installing

reply.author: Logan Graham
reply.content: What watch are you using? I'm not experiencing this behavior on my device.

title: Completely takes over your watch

author: Gerard Ibanez
comment: Really nice face. Simple and elegant. I wish the digital face font was bigger, looks small compared to roboto
title: Great

author: Rich Erickson
comment: Like the title says, notifications overlap the date, which makes the date and the notification hard to read. Plus, all app settings must be done on the watch. It would be nice to adjust the settings on the phone app.
title: Notifications overlap the date on Samsung Gear Live plus...

author: Charlie Rappa
comment: I really like how this watch face looks but having to go through the wear menus to change colors etc is very tedious and would prefer the option to do so from the mobile app.

reply.author: Logan Graham
reply.content: This is currently something that's being worked on to allow for customization from both ends - then synced (So if the phone is disconnected / the device is in airplane mode the customizations can still be made).

title: Great look but tedious

author: Brandon McAnsh
comment: Cards showing on dimmed screen cover up some of the time and/or date when show date is enabled.
title: Great but...

author: Tony Bombardo
comment: Unless I did something wrong... when I have the watch (moto 360) in always-on mode and the watchface set to NOT auto-dim the text or background, the screen will dim after a few seconds, then not return to full brightness unless you physically tap it, i.e. lifting/flicking/turning your wrist to view the watch face doesn't do anything.
title: Pretty good but there's something wrong

author: Norman Lau
comment: Thanks. I am using Sony Smart Watch 3 but there is no battery icon. I cannot find it in preferences.
title: Like it but missing battery icon

author: Jason Zeleny
comment: This is a great face and the dev is awesome and willing to improve based on feedback. Thanks so much!!!

reply.author: Logan Graham
reply.content: Seconds have been added to the app in version 1.1 (July 18) - be sure to check for an update!

title: Very nice! Five stars for the seconds :)

author: Chris Clanton
comment: If you have the gear live, use the black background for big battery savings. Hope he updates by 1/31/15 so we don't lose the watchface

reply.author: Logan Graham
reply.content: Updates are on the way. You can access the new API version by joining the BETA group. Thanks for the feedback!

title: Love the simplicity

author: jeremy stewart
comment: ...The cards didn't cover up the date... It would be great if there was an option to raise the clock and date to the top of the screen so the date isn't covered up

reply.author: Logan Graham
reply.content: This option is currently in BETA v 1.1.1b (I do not have an LG G-Watch to test and confirm that it is out of the Card's way - it appears to work on the Gear Live).

title: Would be 5 stars if...

reply.author: Logan Graham
reply.content: Text Color customization has been added to the app in version 1.1 (July 18) - be sure to check for an update!

author: Fianeis Sew
comment: If only I can change settings from accompanied phone.
title: Nice and simple.
